cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference so far is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Ranked 8th for total rainfall, today's storm had precipitation totalling 13.04mm, falling at 8.6mm per hour at times during the 7.9 hour long storm.  On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 27.64mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 15.9 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking top from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 when 24.56mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 6.4mm per hour.
A storm is currently nearby.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 5th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 9 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (202°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 75.89 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1550 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 42.1m higher than yesterday, 445.7m lower than the past week, 1549.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 713m to a maximum of 1594m, averaging 1109.1m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1554.8m and 2660m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and little or no wind. Periods of rain anticipated, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and periods of sunshine are expected. Changeable conditions.
